# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    lowercase!(col)  # Lowercase the string
    lstrip!(col)      # Remove leading whitespaces
    rstrip!(col)       # Remove trailing whitespaces
    replace!(col, " " => "_")   # Replace spaces with underscores
    replace!(col, "-" => "_")     # Replace hyphens with underscores
    return col
end

clean_column("My Column")  # Output: "my_column"
```

The `clean_column` function takes a column name as input and follows the given steps to clean the column name. The cleaned column name is then returned.
